Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Sclerotherapy and Intralesional Excision for Aneurysmal Bone Cysts

Trial_Design.evidence: Ninety-four patients were randomly assigned to two treatment groups

Intervention.evidence: Group 1 received sclerotherapy, and Group 2 underwent intralesional excision and bone grafting

Objective.evidence: This study aims to compare the healing rates and safety of percutaneous repetitive sclerotherapy using polidocanol with intralesional excision

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the healing rate, measured over a minimum follow-up of 3.2 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to treatment allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: Ninety-four patients were randomly assigned to two treatment groups

Number_Analysed.evidence: Ninety-one patients were analysed (45 in Group 1 and 46 in Group 2) using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: At last follow-up, healing was achieved in 93.3% of Group 1 and 84.8% of Group 2

Harms.evidence: Group 1 experienced minor complications that resolved, while Group 2 had three deep infections, five superficial infections, and two growth disturbances
